definitions.definition: To use in place of something else, with the same function .
examples: I had no shallots so I substituted onion.

definitions.definition: To use X in place of Y.
examples: I had to substitute new parts for the old ones.
labels: in the phrase "substitute X for Y"
definitions.label_groups: transitive , in the phrase "substitute X for Y"

definitions.definition: To use Y in place of X; to replace X with Y.
examples: I had to substitute old parts with the new ones.
definitions.label_groups: transitive , formerly proscribed , in the phrase "substitute X with/by Y"

definitions.definition: To remove (a player) from the field of play and bring on another in his place.
examples: He was playing poorly and was substituted after twenty minutes

definitions.definition: To serve as a replacement (for someone or something).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To use in place of something else, with the same function .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , in the phrase "substitute X for Y" ) To use X in place of Y.
( transitive , formerly proscribed , in the phrase "substitute X with/by Y" ) To use Y in place of X; to replace X with Y.
( transitive , sports ) To remove (a player) from the field of play and bring on another in his place.
( intransitive ) To serve as a replacement (for someone or something).
